intro: Gyrostachys sulphurea, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
